intro: Nicotiana hoskingii, commonly known as the Hosking's tobacco, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family. It is native to the arid regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
